summary: This is a promotional email from the Financial Times dated February 13, 2020, containing news headlines. One headline indicates that Barclays' CEO Jes Staley was being investigated over his links to Jeffrey Epstein. The document is a routine news digest email.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Mentioned in a news headline stating he was being probed over links to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual to whom Jes Staley had links that were under investigation.

persons.name: Anil Prasad
persons.context: Mentioned in a separate markets headline about shutting down the Silver Ridge hedge fund.

connections.description: The document states Jes Staley was being probed over his links to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating an association under investigation.

events.title: Barclays' Jes Staley probed over Epstein links
events.description: News report indicates Barclays CEO Jes Staley was under investigation regarding his connections to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: London EC4M 9BT (Registered office of Financial Times Group Limited)
keyFacts: On February 13, 2020, the Financial Times reported that Barclays CEO Jes Staley was being investigated over his links to Jeffrey Epstein.
The document is a standard promotional email from the Financial Times, indicating the Epstein case was still generating corporate and financial news at that time.
The email shows the Epstein case had ramifications in the financial sector, leading to investigations of high-profile banking executives.
